intro: Garnotia mezii var. maculata, commonly known as the spotted garnotia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with a distinctive spotted or mottled pattern. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
